definition: to found a state/to open a closed country

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
variant of 開國元勳|开国元勋, founding figure (of country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company, school etc
founding figure (of a country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company or school etc
outstanding founding minister (title given to reward loyal general or vassal of new dynasty or state)

sentences.english: Chin Shihhuang, also named Yingzheng , is the founder of the Qin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇，姓贏名政，是秦朝的開國皇帝。

sentences.english: Jiang Kai countries after the surgery, bought a ticket to go home immediately.
sentences.chinese: 江開國在手術以後，自己買了車票要立即回家。

sentences.english: It is an interpretation of executive power that would make the Founders whirl in their graves.
sentences.chinese: 這一關於行政權力的解釋會讓開國先賢們死不瞑目。

sentences.english: I was there when the ceremony (of the Founding of the PRC)going.
sentences.chinese: 我能參加開國大典那真是十分榮幸。

sentences.english: Kai Guo Da Dian is a documentary.
XIAO-Yan is the first emperor of the Liang Dynasty in Wei and Jin era.
sentences.chinese: 梁武帝蕭衍是魏晉南北朝時期梁朝的開國帝王。

sentences.english: If Rexroth was the founding father, Madeline Gleason was the founding mother.
sentences.chinese: 如果力士樂是開國元勳，麥德蘭格里森是創始母親。

sentences.english: It was a  creed written into the founding documents that declared the  destiny of a nation.
sentences.chinese: 它是寫進開國憲章的信條，宣示了這個國家的命運。

sentences.english: Octavian became the first emperor of a new era.
sentences.chinese: 屋大維成爲了一個新時代的開國皇帝。

sentences.english: Everyone is particularly concerned about the origin of Fang Qiong, Jiang Kai countries back to her to do the fish soup.
sentences.chinese: 大家都特別關心方瓊的來歷，江開國還給她做了魚湯。

sentences.english: He is the first king of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 他就是以色列的開國元君。

sentences.english: Want to go to find the adopter professor shen Jiang Kai countries.
sentences.chinese: 江開國想去找收養人沈教授。

sentences.english: Mulan and Jiang Kai once again return to my grandfather home, finally found my grandpa.
sentences.chinese: 木蘭和江開國再次回到爺爺老家廢墟，終於找到爺爺。

sentences.english: Last of New China's first generals cremated.
sentences.chinese: 中國最後一位開國上將呂正操下葬。

sentences.english: Our founders believed in universal values.
sentences.chinese: 美國的開國元勳們相信共同價值。

sentences.english: XIAO-Yan is the first emperor of the hang Dynasty in Wei and Jin era.
sentences.chinese: 梁武帝蕭衍是魏晉南北朝時期梁朝的開國帝王。

definition: Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to found a country/nation-building/the foundation of PRC by Mao Zedong in 1949
to load into/to record/to write into/to enter (data)/to go into (the records)/to go down (in history)
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
